question_sentence: Which K-pop star had to apologise to fans for being in a relationship?
evidence: The leader of South Korean girl group Aespa issued a handwritten apology after her fans discovered she had a boyfriend. Some went so far as to show up at her agency angrily declaring their displeasure. K-pop stars are often marketed as being romantically obtainable and many have "no dating" clauses in their contracts.

question_sentence: How many new bills did Louisiana’s governor sign in an attempt to crack down on crime?
evidence: The recently approved bills "lengthen sentences for some offenses, to strictly limit access to parole, to prosecute 17-year-olds charged with any crime as adults, and to allow methods of execution beyond lethal injection". Louisiana's governor, Jeff Landry, believes the new bills will "put the interests of victims before the interests of criminals".

question_sentence: Fans of which football club left only 15 minutes into their match against Arsenal?
evidence: After Gabriel Martinelli put Arsenal 3-0 up in the 15th minute, a number of Sheffield United supporters began filing out of Bramall Lane. It sparked debate over fans abandoning their teams before the full-time whistle, with Blades manager Chris Wilder saying he “totally understands”. The match ended 6-0 to Arsenal.

question_sentence: Which planet, once thought to have the potential for sustaining life, has less oxygen on its surface than anticipated?
evidence: Jupiter's moon, Europa, is believed to have a salty ocean under its icy shell. Some scientists think that Europa's oxygen – formed when particles from space split frozen water molecules on the icy crust into hydrogen and oxygen – sinks down into the subterranean ocean, mixing with volcanic material to create a "chemical soup that may end up making life".

question_sentence: Which member of the royal family's uncle is in 'Celebrity Big Brother' this year?
evidence: The Princess of Wales's uncle Gary Goldsmith has already courted controversy on the ITV reality show by telling the other contestants that Meghan Markle had put a "stick in the spokes" of a previously "really comfortable" relationship between the Duke of Sussex and the Prince and Princess of Wales.

question_sentence: The US will release its first over-the-counter birth control pill under what name?
evidence: The availability of birth control in the US has traditionally "been dependent on access to health insurance and to a regular health care provider who could prescribe it". The new contraceptive "will soon become the most effective birth-control method available without a doctor's visit".

question_sentence: A leaked German military recording appeared to claim soldiers from which country are fighting in Ukraine?
evidence: German Defence Minister Boris Pistorius announced that an initial investigation of the leak indicated a participant joined the call on a non-secure line and Russia is likely to have intercepted it from there. The incident has inflamed the long-tense relationship between Nato and Moscow.

question_sentence: Which country became the first to enshrine abortion rights in its constitution?
evidence: Abortion has been legal in France since 1975 and, after a 780-27 vote on Monday, it is now a constitutional right. "We're sending a message to all women: Your body belongs to you, and no one can decide for you," said Prime Minister Gabriel Attal. However, the Vatican disagrees, saying "there can be no 'right' to take a human life".

question_sentence: What makes up the largest proportion of dangerous animals kept as pets in the UK?
evidence: There are more than 400 licences for venomous snakes in the UK – 10 times more than are being kept in zoos, according to the wildlife charity Born Free. There has been a sharp rise in the number of dangerous animals kept in the UK with more than 2,700 now registered, including lions, tigers and crocodiles.

question_sentence: A new system known as 'dynamic pricing' is being tested by which large fast food chain?
evidence: Wendy's CEO Kirk Tanner announced the restaurant chain will be trying out new features. One of them is surge pricing, which is the practice of pricing a product based on fluctuating demand. Wendy's said this would "allow us to change the menu offerings at different times of day and offer discounts and value offers to our customers" during slower periods.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court made a major ruling this week that former President Donald Trump must appear on the presidential ballot in which state, whose leadership had challenged Trump’s eligibility to hold office?
evidence: The ruling regarding ballots in Colorado will set a precedent for other states with similar pending challenges. Arguments about Trump’s eligibility stem from the 14th Amendment’s “insurrectionist clause.” (Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell/AP)

question_sentence: Which basketball star became the first in NBA history to score 40,000 career points
evidence: LeBron James has been blazing his own trail since surpassing Kareem Abdul-Jabbar’s 38,387 points to become the NBA’s all-time leading scorer last season. (Image credit: Mark J. Terrill/AP)

question_sentence: Which university is at the center of an unprecedented antisemitism investigation headed by the House Education and Workforce Committee?
evidence: The committee issued multiple subpoenas to Harvard University in February, marking the first time the panel has made such a move in its more than 150-year history. Now, the committee says Harvard isn’t complying with the requests. (Image credit: Aaron M. Sprecher/AP)

question_sentence: Memphis Mayor Paul Young met with local gang leaders to negotiate a ceasefire and reduce gang violence in the city long-term. What was one main solution the gang leaders said could help people avoid gang life?
evidence: The gang leaders told Young more well-paying jobs and training could help get young people out of the cycle of violence. Young took office in January with a focus on public safety. (Image credit: Joe Murphy/Getty Images/File)

question_sentence: International organizations are warning which complication is adding to the death toll in Gaza as violence there continues.
evidence: The World Health Organization and Palestinian officials warn hundreds of thousands of people in Gaza are at risk of famine. (Image credit: Mohammed Salem/Reuters)

question_sentence: Scientists recently nixed a proposal to name a new geological era to capture the impact of human activity on the planet. What was the proposed epoch called?
evidence: Members of the Subcommission on Quaternary Stratigraphy, which is part of the International Union of Geological Sciences, rejected the proposal for an Anthropocene epoch in part because they couldn’t agree on when such an era would have begun. (Image credit: Peter Power/AFP/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Taylor Swift recently found out she is related to which famous poet?
evidence: The company Ancestry, which helps people trace their genealogy, has found evidence that Swift is distantly related to the famed poet Emily Dickinson. (Image credit: Culture Club/Hulton Archive/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which state is dealing with the fallout of a major ruling by its Supreme Court regarding in-vitro fertilization?
evidence: Alabama’s Supreme Court ruled that frozen embryos are human beings and that those who destroy them can be held liable for wrongful death. The state’s governor, Kay Ivey, signed new legislation that could protect families and providers from consequences, but experts say more needs to be done. (Image credit: Mickey Welsh/USA Today Network)

question_sentence: The United Nations’ World Food Program has issued a dire warning that the people of Sudan are facing “the world’s largest hunger crisis.” What is the main reason for the country’s current critical levels of hunger?
evidence: Warring forces in Sudan have killed thousands and displaced millions, and the instability has led to nine in 10 people there facing “emergency levels of hunger.” (Image credit: Michael Kappeler/picture-alliance/dpa/AP/File)

question_sentence: A major shift has changed the SAT experience forever. What is it?
choices: There is no more reading portion
Students can take it at home
evidence: In addition to being fully digital, the new test is shorter and adapts to students’ answers as they go. (Image credit: Chris Pedota/NorthJersey.com/USA Today Network)

question_sentence: What is the name of the service dog that recently joined the Delaware State Fire Commission, and what is its primary role?
choices: Roy- To assist in fire rescue operations
Alec - To assist in fire rescue operations
Rover - To comfort victims, teach fire safety, and assist in stress management among first responders
Ajax - To comfort victims, teach fire safety, and assist in stress management among first responders

question_sentence: What is the primary goal of the “Poor People’s Campaign” rally held in Dover on March 2, 2024?
choices: To protest against the government’s policies
To encourage people in poverty to vote and demand change
To raise funds for the homeless
To provide food and shelter for the poor

question_sentence: In Delaware, late April is considered to be the best time to set up, freshen or clean out feeders to attract which bird species?
What is the starting state salary portion for a paraprofessional in Delaware schools?
What was a key focus of Delaware Gov. John Carney’s last State of the State address?
choices: Addressing Delaware’s soaring health care costs
Decreasing investments in agriculture and environment

question_sentence: What is the origin of the name “Murderkill River” in Delaware?
choices: It was named after a famous serial killer.
It’s derived from the Dutch words for “Mother River”
It’s named after a historical massacre that took place there.
It’s named after a species of bird found in the area.

question_sentence: What is the main reason for adding shot clocks in Delaware high school basketball, according to the coaches?
choices: To speed up the game and end the use of stalling tactics
To increase the number of games in a season
To increase the difficulty level of the game
To attract more audience to the games

question_sentence: Which Major League Soccer player, originally from Queens, New York, has been living in Wilmington’s Riverfront for the past three years?
What was the settlement amount that ChristianaCare agreed to pay to settle a nearly 7-year-old whistleblower lawsuit?
Who became the 13th four-time champion at the DIAA Wrestling Tournament?
